title: Unable to clear RBR when the composer is not showing

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from this [report](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764131632533319)

### Problem
When user runs into a situation where a report has RBR error and the composer is not showing for various reasons, we also do not show the RBR option to dismiss the error so they are stuck with the failing report


### Solution

Ensure that if there is a report with RBR, we always show the error and X to dismiss it that will clear this stale report

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @</details>

If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.82-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/74652 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+khdjdjdjsjsk@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense of amount 12.00. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Click More > Split. 6. Go to Percent. 7. Enter 50.2% for the first split. 8. On the second split, enter 49.8%. 9. Remove 8 from the second split so that it becomes 49. ## Expected Result: The first split percentage will not change. ## Actual Result: The first split percentage changes to 50.1% when the second split is changed to 49. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9b4c5f5-7b13-4e90-9ee4-a3e3e13359aa [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$75] Update ghost text in Expense Threads / Reports

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C090U774ZH7/p1766084764506399?thread_ts=1766084764.506399&cid=C090U774ZH7 **What the problem is:** The current ghost/placeholder text in report and expense comment boxes is generic: "Write something". The team agreed this does not communicate that Concierge AI can take actions based on the comment, so users may not realize Concierge can create or update expenses. **What the expected output is:** Replace the generic placeholder with copy that clearly signals Concierge can act. The agreed candidate phrases to surface randomly are: Ask Concierge AI to create an expense... Ask Concierge AI to update an expense... Ask Concierge AI to correct an expense... This should only be the placeholder text within expense threads / reports

body:
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/576448 ## Expected Result: In a user's status page, if they are set as the Vacation Delegate of anyone else, we want to show this so it's clear they have been set as someone's delegate. Note: users who are someone else's Vacation Delegate should NOT be able to set a delegate of their own (this follows OldDot behavior) Another note: There are probably backend change associated with this (example: Making sure users get live updates when someone sets them as their vacation delegate). Note any of those changes that we may need to implement and we will find someone to implement üëç ## Screenshots/Videos Plan for NewDot: Similar view from OldDot: [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
In the following scenario: - User is on Reports ‚Üí To-do ‚Üí Submit - User clicks Global Create > Scan (and workspace has a delayed submission frequency enabled) - No existing report exists Then the user confusingly sees $0.00 in the amount column. We should instead communicate that the receipt on the one-expense report is `Scanning`, like so.
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @jasperhuangg

title: Add `Converted` amount in expense thread for multi-currency cash expenses

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We're encountering user confusion in multi-currency "cash expense" situations, specifically when the expense purchase currency and the workspace currency are not the same. We already handle this natively for the Expensify Card and third-party credit cards, via an `Original` pattern (like below). We'd like to handle this similarly cash expenses, including receipt scans and per diem expenses (Note: distance and time expenses use a rate and amount that matches the workspace currency, so they don't apply.). All in all the solution looks like this: - When `expense-type` is `cash` or `per diem `... - In the expense thread... - Show `Converted` text in the "dot separator," followed by the amount in the workspace output currency.... - What appears in the `Amount` push row is the original purchase currency and amount (unless manually changed by the user).
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @ZhenjaHorbach
